result.execSummary:
All charges against Keenan D Pointer in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keenan D Pointer is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan D Pointer

records.addlTxt:
Sakura Pointer in custody. Attorney Toran in court with Defendant Sakura Pointer. Michael Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared on 08/06/22 for initial appearance. Defendant's extradition paperwork was incorrect. REISSUED IN CASE 22CF3134.
Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Defendant Keenan D Pointer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Keenan D Pointer in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Court found the Defendant is the person wanted in the State of Lousiana. Defendant WAIVED Extradition and signed Waiver. Court ordered the Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
